com.digitalpebble.stormcrawler.filtering.regex

Class RegexURLNormalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.digitalpebble.stormcrawler.filtering.regex.RegexURLNormalizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    URLFilter

    public class RegexURLNormalizer
extends Object
implements URLFilter
    The RegexURLNormalizer is a URL filter that normalizes URLs by matching a regular expression and inserting a replacement string. Adapted from Apache Nutch 1.9.

        public void configure(Map stormConf,
                      com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode paramNode)
        Description copied from interface: URLFilter
        Called when this filter is being initialized

        configure in interface URLFilter

        stormConf - The Storm configuration used for the ParserBolt
        paramNode - the filter specific configuration. Never null

      • filter

        public String filter(URL sourceUrl,
                     Metadata sourceMetadata,
                     String urlString)
        This function does the replacements by iterating through all the regex patterns. It accepts a string url as input and returns the altered string. If the normalized url is an empty string, the function will return null.
        Specified by:
        filter in interface URLFilter
        Parameters:
        sourceUrl - the URL of the page where the URL was found. Can be null.
        sourceMetadata - the metadata collected for the page
        urlString - the URL to be filtered
